description: A high-level, interpreted programming language that conforms to the ECMAScript specification. JavaScript is a core technology of the World Wide Web, alongside HTML and CSS.
creator: Brendan Eich

description: A high-level, general-purpose programming language. Its design philosophy emphasizes code readability with the use of significant indentation.
creator: Guido van Rossum

description: HyperText Markup Language is the standard markup language for documents designed to be displayed in a web browser.
Cascading Style Sheets is a style sheet language used for describing the presentation of a document written in HTML or XML.
A free and open-source front-end JavaScript library for building user interfaces based on UI components.
An open-source, cross-platform, back-end JavaScript runtime environment that runs on the V8 engine.
creator: Ryan Dahl

description: Application Programming Interface - a set of protocols, routines, and tools for building software applications.
An organized collection of structured information, or data, typically stored electronically in a computer system.
A finite sequence of well-defined instructions, typically used to solve a class of specific problems or to perform a computation.
A type of artificial intelligence that allows software applications to become more accurate at predicting outcomes without being explicitly programmed.
The on-demand availability of computer system resources, especially data storage and computing power, without direct active management by the user.
The practice of protecting systems, networks, and programs from digital attacks aimed at accessing, changing, or destroying sensitive information.
